author: Odeinoichus
title: Save LEGO City with Fire Helicopter.
review:
Set #30566 Fire Helicopter: LEGO City Polybags constantly bring us the same ideas and concepts with new upgrades or build designs to improve upon past offerings. This little Fire Helicopter is a nifty offering from 2021 and the only one I ever saw at retail despite more planned to be released. Again Polybag supplies seem to have been exceedingly limited last year compared to the past. I suspect a large influx of Polybags for North America may show up during 2022. Hopefully.

Pros:

  • Adorable looking design with stud-shooter functionality.
  • Nice newer visor design for LEGO Helmet pieces.
  • Decent Minifigure offering.

Cons:

  • Availability seriously difficult to accurately predict.
  • Open-Air design makes battling fires tricky for this one-man small craft, smoke inhalation problems and heat issues a genuine thing, should have included breathing tank for Pilot.

Overall opinion

This is another fun and exciting offering from LEGO City Polybags. A decent showing with some new ideas for building at this scale. A small fleet of these would look great in LEGO City Fire department, with perhaps a few modifications to better equip the pilots for search and rescue missions. Greatly Recommended.
